sect1.title: Conspicuous Use of Archives

para.remark: The importance of having all communications be logged and be searchable, with stable references. Describe the misery that results when this is not available -- for example, the pain of the contactor.se/~dast "route around" that resulted from the lossage of the native tigris.org mail archiver. Written guidelines vs precedence is like the distinction between English statutory law and common law. Good archiving is essential for the same reason. It's like an oral tradition with a video camera constantly running.

sect1.para: Perfect example: a named anchor for *every* FAQ item.
sect1.remark: (Also, get Brian B's story of the FreeBSD IRC archives here.)

sect1.para: When to operate overtly, when to operate behind the scenes.

sect1.title: Internal vs External Communications
sect1.para: Internal vs external communications. In free software projects, there tends to be a smooth continuum between purely internal discussions and public relations statements. Discuss how to navigate this continuum. Describe how to hook into the standard real-time news distribution forums (RSS, CIA, etc), and the meta-distribution sites such as Freshmeat.
